title: Le Masciare 2015  Fiano di Avellino
description: This wine's yellow flower, Mediterranean brush and citrus aromas will grab your attention. On the full-bodied palate, a white almond note underscores ripe Bartlett pear, nectarine and candied lemon flavors while a mineral note energizes the finish.

title: Loimer 2016 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine leads with the fruity scent of fresh Conference and yellow pear. Its slightly spritzy palate comes with some yeasty, herbal savoriness and finishes fresh and dry.

title: Maddalena 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This is a very solid wine for its price, with rocky mineral, dried fennel and herbal aromas on the nose. It really shines on the rich and juicy palate, where smoked beef, oregano, marjoram and thyme notes back up the blackberry fruit. Complex and tasty.

title: Maison Saint Aix 2016 Aix Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This is a smooth, beautifully ripe wine. It is well balanced, with crisp red and orange fruits adding a refreshing background to the spice and acidity. This finely made wine is ready to drink.

title: Marion-Field 2014 The Harrison Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Light in color, this wine brings aromas of peppermint, herb, sarsaparilla and spice. The flavors are light and transparent, showing a very pretty sense of styling.

title: Lone Madrone 2014 La Mezcla Roja Red (Paso Robles)
description: Although not super complex, this wine offers a great taste of little used grapes like Counoise and Cinsault. A sharp red cinnamon spice note kicks off the nose, with rose petal and cranberry scents that follow. The palate offers candied sour cherry and peppercorn flavors.

title: Lundeen 2012 Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: This traditional method  sparkler opens with a genteel toastiness on the nose and palate. Fresh and bright fruit flavors suggest apples dusted with cinnamon. It's vintage dated and sourced from a single vineyard. Beware when opening–the cork virtually exploded from the bottle as soon as the capsule was loosened!

title: Grand Napa 2013 Red (Oakville)
description: Made from 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot and 20% Syrah, this blend delivers a densely built body of black fruit and sticky tannins, offering meaty leather and tobacco flavors. The lengthy finish is defined by black pepper.

title: Domaine Jacourette 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: The vines in the prestigious Sainte-Victoire appellation produce a ripe wine, lightly structured and with nervy energy. Apricots and red berries give plenty of richness to this attractive wine. Drink now.

title: Finca La Luz 2014 Callejon de Crimen Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: Aromas of pencil shavings, Band-Aid, prune and black plum are good but shy. This Cabernet feels jammy but also a touch rough and tannic. Blackberry, toast, charred wood, salt and savory plum flavors finish solid but not complex or unique.

title: Eichinger 2016 Strass Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A touch of bergamot perfumes this wine's nose. The palate boasts a concentrated core of savoriness and ample fruit in the green spectrum: pear, lime and greengage. Lemony citrus flavors waft freely on the finish, proving dry and zippy.

title: Hannes Reeh 2015 Zweigelt (Neusiedlersee)
description: While this wine's nose is shy, its palate is completely open, brimming with red cherry. The fruit is aromatic and rounded, with floral touches and a lovely, balanced freshness. This is unpretentious and comes with a light step and a chocolate-tinged finish.

title: Hosmer 2015 Limited Release Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Layers of clove, vanilla and caramel accent this concentrated Chardonnay without being overtly flashy or cloying. It's a satisfyingly full-bodied wine with crisp lemon and red-apple flavors that maintain precision on the midpalate. The finish is long and refreshing.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Apple blossoms and crisp Asian pears perfume this exceptionally light-footed Chardonnay. While delicate in style, concentrated green apple, quince, and integrated oak tones lend oomph to the midpalate. The finish is long, fresh and blossomy. Drink now through 2018.

title: Dürnberg 2015 Bodenschatz Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: Fresh, ripe, luscious black cherry notes abound on the nose and palate of this wine. It's medium bodied, round and smooth, with ample freshness to counter its exuberant fruit. Frehsness and a slight tannic grip make for a lip-smacking finish.

title: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2015 Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: 2015's ripe red cherry fruit is presented here in a compact, taut, and concentrated package of freshness and verve. It has lovely pepper spice and ample freshness, giving focus to its lovely, crunchy, fresh cherry fruit.

title: Parxet 2012 Titiana Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty bready aromas are more smooth and leesy than fruity. This has a round palate that's full but not creamy due to firm acidity. Melon, peach and vanilla flavors finish yeasty and dry, with moderate complexity. This is made entirely from Pinot Noir.

title: Rexford 2013 Regan Vineyards Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Father-and-son vintners Joe and Sam Miller consistently deliver solid wines, including this twist-top Merlot that's aged in 50% new French oak. Its boysenberry fruit is awash in the green peppercorn, herb and crushed graphite character associated with the mountainous region. That pyrazine touch hits the palate, along with black pepper and dark chocolate spice, accenting the tangy red fruit.

title: Ruca Malen 2012 Kinien Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This bulky bullish Malbec opens with big tarry aromas that go heavy on the oak. The palate is tannic like the clack-clack of heels on a tile floor. This tastes earthy, oaky and like blackberry, while the finish echoes with those same flavors. Drink through 2023.

title: Ruca Malen 2013 Reserva Petit Verdot (Mendoza)
description: Dry spicy aromas accent woodsy berry scents. A tight focused palate jabs with acidity and poking tannins, while this tastes of lightly herbal cherry and berry fruit. Spicy flavors on a healthy finish help this along.

title: Esterházy 2015 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Red cherry and plum scents beckon in the glass. The palate is equally friendly and fruit-forward, delivering plush, ripe but refreshing flavors with generous body. Those plum and cherry notes linger, accented with hints of cinnamon and pervaded by lively, refreshing acidity.

title: Esterházy 2016 Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: A touch of fennel and grass plays on the nose of this wine. The palate is juicy and fresh, with ripe and full-bodied yellow apple fruit countered by crispness. This is uncomplicated but clean and moreish, with a lemony note that lasts into the finish.

title: Moniker 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Full bodied and well balanced, this wine has a broad, mouthfilling texture and enough concentration to carry its rich fruit notes into the finish. Cedar and black currant aromas meet black cherry and blackberry flavors, while a layer of fine-grained tannins frames the whole picture.

title: Markowitsch 2015 Rubin Carnuntum Zweigelt (Carnuntum)
description: Fresh but ripe cherry notes shine on nose and palate of this wine. The body is fluid and has a pleasant weight: neither light nor heavy, with just enough density and freshness to fill the palate with its exuberant cherry fruit.

title: Marshall Davis 2015 Marshall Davis Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Concentrated red fruits are matched to lushly toasty barrel flavors. This ripe and forward wine is ready right now. Textural in the mouth, it piles on the nuances, with toasted coconut, vanilla tea and a touch of stem threading through the finish.

title: Occasio 2015 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Pastry shop aromas and abundant vanilla and nutmeg flavors make this wine easy to like. It's nicely dry and medium-bodied despite those initial sweet impressions, with a moderate dose of apple and lemon fruit for support.

title: Roar 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Cloudy in the glass, this appellation blend shows watermelon, juniper and graphite on the nose, accenting its forward primary fruit aromas. There's an energetic tang to the sip, with a full-bodied mouthfeel and cranberry and anise flavors.

title: Quady North 2015 La Battalla de Don Nato Cabernet Franc-Malbec (Rogue Valley)
description: This blend of 72% Cabernet Franc and 28% Malbec is different from the debut 2014 vintage. It's a young stiff tannic wine, with tart cranberry fruit streaked with herbs and olives, all well-proportioned. Native yeast and neutral oak was used, with one-third done as a whole-cluster ferment.

title: Steininger 2015 Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: A touch of cinnamon hovers above this wine's abundant, ripe, red and black cherry fruit. The palate is fluid, juicy and bouncy, with a warming core of spice. Freshness balances and guides everything. Very harmonious and honest.

title: Stift Göttweig 2015 Goettweiger Berg Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)
description: Although the nose is rather shy and closed, the palate expands with supple red fruit and spicy tartness. This is a mellow, light-bodied Pinot Noir that's elegant and full of freshness, with a heart of plump, red fruit ready for drinking now.
